snippet: The Obama administration announced a modest and temporary freeze on military assistance to Egypt, even as officials emphasized a desire to avoid rupturing a three-decade-old security relationship.
abstract: Obama administration announces a modest and temporary freeze on military assistance to Egypt, even as American officials emphasize their desire to avoid rupturing a security relationship that stretches back more than three decades.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and MARK LANDLER
byline.contributor: David D. Kirkpatrick contributed reporting from Cairo, and Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: The Obama administration announced a modest and temporary freeze on military assistance to Egypt, even as officials emphasized a desire to avoid rupturing a three-decade-old security relationship.

headline.main: In Crackdown Response, U.S. Temporarily Freezes Some Military Aid to Egypt
headline.print_headline: In Crackdown Response, U.S. Temporarily Freezes Some Military Aid to Egypt
